channel.title: SpaceX on 无关紧要的宇宙
channel.description: Recent content in SpaceX on 无关紧要的宇宙

item.title: EchoStar to sell spectrum to SpaceX after FCC threatened to revoke licenses
item.description: Starlink says $17 billion spectrum purchase will improve its cellphone service.

item.title: EchoStar offloads satellite spectrum to SpaceX for $17 billion

item.title: EchoStar offloads satellite spectrum to SpaceX for $17 billion

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX to Buy EchoStar Spectrum for $17 Billion, Fund $2 Billion in Debt Interest Payments
item.description: The companies also reach a long-term commercial agreement, “which will enable EchoStar’s Boost Mobile subscribers to access SpaceX’s next-generation Starlink Direct to Cell service.”

item.description: The companies also reach a long-term commercial agreement, “which will enable EchoStar’s Boost Mobile subscribers to access SpaceX’s next-generation Starlink Direct to Cell service.”

item.title: Lull in Falcon Heavy missions opens window for SpaceX to build new landing pads
item.description: There are no Falcon Heavy launches this year, so now’s the time for SpaceX to act.

item.title: Fuel supply is a bottleneck for Starship—here’s how SpaceX will get around it
item.description: SpaceX has flirted with the idea of propellant generation plants at Starbase before.

item.title: Falcon 9 Milestones Vindicate SpaceX’s ‘Dumb’ Approach to Reuse
item.description: The workhorse rocket has continued its streak of success.

item.title: Falcon 9 Milestones Vindicate SpaceX’s ‘Dumb’ Approach to Reuse
item.description: The workhorse rocket has continued its streak of success.

item.title: SpaceX got good heat shield data for Starship, so what comes next?
item.description: “The latest upgrades are looking good!”

item.title: Starship’s heat shield appears to have performed quite well in test
item.description: “The latest upgrades are looking good!”

item.title: Rocket Report: SpaceX achieved daily launch this week; ULA recovers booster
item.description: Firefly Aerospace reveals why its Alpha booster exploded after launch in April.

item.title: With recent Falcon 9 milestones, SpaceX vindicates its “dumb” approach to reuse
item.description: The company’s workhorse continues its stellar performance.

item.title: Under pressure after setbacks, SpaceX’s huge rocket finally goes the distance
item.description: This was the first successful flight of SpaceX’s second-generation Starship after three failures.

item.title: SpaceX Starship Finally Pulls Off a Successful Test Flight
item.description: After being postponed twice—and after multiple failed attempts—Starship’s tenth test flight was a success.

item.title: SpaceX Starship Finally Pulls Off a Successful Test Flight
item.description: After being postponed twice—and after multiple failed attempts—Starship’s tenth test flight was a success.

item.title: With Starship, SpaceX encounters an obstacle that haunted NASA’s space shuttles
item.description: “We wish we were young again and NASA was this vivacious, you know?”

item.title: SpaceX’s latest Dragon mission will breathe more fire at the space station
item.description: “The boost kit will help sustain the orbiting lab’s altitude, starting in September.”

item.title: Time is running out for SpaceX to make a splash with second-gen Starship
item.description: SpaceX is gearing up for another Starship launch after three straight disappointing test flights.

item.title: US military’s X-37B spaceplane stays relevant with launch of another mission
item.description: The X-37B spaceplane is flying missions few would have foreseen when the program began.

item.title: Starlink wants billions in grants, but state governments aren’t cooperating
item.description: Despite Trump’s backing, states aren’t giving Starlink the money it demanded.

item.title: SpaceX has built the machine to build the machine. But what about the machine?
item.description: SpaceX has built an impressive production site in Texas. Will Starship success follow?

item.title: SpaceX says states should dump fiber plans, give all grant money to Starlink
item.description: SpaceX seeks more cash, calls fiber “wasteful and unnecessary taxpayer spending.”

item.title: SpaceX reveals why the last two Starships failed as another launch draws near
item.description: “SpaceX can now proceed with Starship Flight 10 launch operations under its current license.”

item.title: Rocket Report: Ariane 6 beats Vulcan to third launch; China’s first drone ship
item.description: Why is China’s heavy-lift Long March 5B able to launch only 10 Guowang satellites at a time?

item.title: Starlink tries to block Virginia’s plan to bring fiber Internet to residents
item.description: SpaceX wants more money, asks Trump admin to reject state’s broadband grant plan.

item.title: Trump orders cull of regulations governing commercial rocket launches
item.description: The head of the FAA’s commercial spaceflight division will become a political appointee.

item.title: Starlink Mini users just lost their beloved pause feature

item.description: John Glenn’s Friendship 7 returns as SpaceX and Blue Origin artifacts debut.

item.title: Starlink kept me connected to the Internet without fail—until Thursday
item.description: “Starlink went down across the entire front.”

item.title: Rocket Report: Channeling the future at Wallops; SpaceX recovers rocket wreckage
item.description: China’s Space Pioneer seems to be back on track a year after an accidental launch.

item.title: SpaceX launches a pair of NASA satellites to probe the origins of space weather
item.description: “This is going to really help us understand how to predict space weather in the magnetosphere.”

item.title: Trump wants to “eliminate or expedite” environmental rules for rocket launches
item.description: SpaceX, other commercial launch firms, have been seeking this change in policy.

item.description: “Europe is seizing the opportunity to lead.”

item.title: Amazon’s ride on the rocket merry-go-round continues with SpaceX launch
item.description: Amazon has launched 78 of its planned 3,232 Kuiper broadband satellites.
